newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Arafat, Netanyahu to meet on Sunday -adviser.
newsitem.headline: Arafat, Netanyahu to meet on Sunday -adviser.

text.p: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Palestinian President Yasser Arafat will meet on Sunday at the border between Israel and the Gaza Strip, an Arafat adviser said on Wednesday.
Netanyahu had called off a meeting scheduled for Thursday after 73 soldiers died in northern Israel on Tuesday in the worst air disaster in the country's military history.
The two men were to discuss implementation of the Hebron agreement signed last month.
"The meeting between President Arafat and Prime Minister Netanyahu will be held on Sunday evening," Nabil Abu Rdaineh, Arafat's adviser, told Reuters.
A spokesman in Netanyahu's office said he was checking the report of the meeting.
